results.name: BubbleChart

nodes.label: New Notes Node
nodes.info:
Provide a concise note or insight about the topic, typically 50-150 words. Focus on a specific aspect, observation, or connection relevant to your project or knowledge graph. For example, highlight a key idea, historical detail, cultural significance, or interdisciplinary link. Structure the text for clarity (e.g., a single paragraph or short list). If applicable, include:

1. [Key Idea: e.g., a specific insight or observation]
2. [Context: e.g., why this matters or its relevance]

Keep the tone clear and engaging, avoiding overly complex terms. Ensure the note adds value by connecting to broader themes or nodes in your graph.
bibl: [Author Last Name, First Initial. (Year). Title of the work. Publisher. DOI/URL]
[Source 1: e.g., book title, article, or URL]
[Source 2: e.g., academic paper, traditional text, or oral source]

nodes.label: Tilopa â Mahasiddhaen med Fisken
nodes.info:
[SECTION | background-color:'#FFF5E5'; color:'#222']
**Tilopa** (ca. 988â1069) var en indisk Mahasiddha og tantrisk mester, mest kjent som lÃ¦remesteren til Naropa. Han regnes som en av grunnleggerne av den tibetanske Kagyu-linjen og symboliserer det direkte mÃ¸tet med opplyst bevissthet, uten mellomledd eller intellektuelle konsepter.

I ikonografien vises Tilopa ofte sittende i meditasjon med en **fisk i hÃ¥nden**. Dette er ikke tilfeldig â fisken representerer:

- **Ãndelig frihet** â fri bevegelse i eksistensens hav
- **Non-dual visdom** â spontan og uhindret
- **Direkte overfÃ¸ring** â erfaringens kraft fremfor teori

Tilopas liv var preget av radikal praksis og opplÃ¸sning av dualistiske forestillinger. Han mottok instruksjoner gjennom visjoner og erfaring, og overfÃ¸rte denne levende innsikten til Naropa â ikke gjennom bÃ¸ker, men gjennom det som kalles *direkte overfÃ¸ring*.

Dette gjÃ¸r fisken i hÃ¥nden hans til mer enn et symbol: den er et uttrykk for lÃ¦ren selv.
[END SECTION]

nodes.label: Ancient Sites of Anatolia and Beyond
nodes.info: This map highlights ancient sites significant to early human history and cultural development, including GÃ¶bekli Tepe, Karahan Tepe, Mount Nemrut, KarakuÅ Tumulus, Ephesus (Turkey), and Vijayalaya Choleeswaram (India). These locations, mapped using KML, represent pivotal centers of Neolithic revolution, ancient worship, and architectural innovation. [Key Idea: GÃ¶bekli Tepe and Karahan Tepe predate Stonehenge by millennia, suggesting advanced communal practices.] [Context: Exploring these sites connects to broader themes of human spirituality, cultural exchange, and the evolution of sacred spaces, enriching our understanding of ancient civilizations in the Vegvisr knowledge graph.]

results.name: QuadrantChart

nodes.label: Campaign Quadrant Chart
nodes.info:
quadrantChart
    title Reach and engagement of campaigns
    x-axis Low Reach --> High Reach
    y-axis Low Engagement --> High Engagement
    quadrant-1 We should expand
    quadrant-2 Need to promote
    quadrant-3 Re-evaluate
    quadrant-4 May be improved
    Campaign A: [0.3, 0.6]
    Campaign B: [0.45, 0.23]
    Campaign C: [0.57, 0.69]
    Campaign D: [0.78, 0.34]
    Campaign E: [0.40, 0.34]
    Campaign F: [0.35, 0.78]

results.name: FlowChart

nodes.label: System Flow Diagram
nodes.info:
graph TD
A[Vegvisr.org System Flow] --> B[Feature: Personal Playground]
B --> C[Release: v1.3.0]
C --> D[Release Notes]
C --> E[Documentation]
B --> F[Planned: Share Playgrounds]
F --> G[Roadmap Q3 2024]
H[Feature: ViewOnly Role] --> C
I[Feedback: Suggest a Feature] --> F

results.ai_instructions: { "format": { "types": { "flow_chart": { "syntax": "graph TD", "structure": [ "graph TD", "[Node Label] --> [Connected Node]", "[Node Label] --> [Connected Node]" ], "style": "clear and hierarchical" }, "gantt_chart": { "syntax": "gantt", "structure": [ "gantt", "title [Title]", "dateFormat YYYY-MM-DD", "section [Section Name]", "[Task Name] :[status], [id], [start-date], [duration]" ], "style": "chronological and organized" }, "quadrant_chart": { "syntax": "quadrantChart", "structure": [ "quadrantChart", "title [Title]", "x-axis [Low Label] --> [High Label]", "y-axis [Low Label] --> [High Label]", "quadrant-1 [Description]", "quadrant-2 [Description]", "quadrant-3 [Description]", "quadrant-4 [Description]", "[Item]: [x-value, y-value]" ], "style": "analytical and clear" } } }, "validation": { "common": { "title": "required", "indentation": "4 spaces", "max_items": 50 }, "specific": { "flow_chart": { "max_nodes": 30, "max_connections": 50 }, "gantt_chart": { "date_format": "YYYY-MM-DD", "max_tasks": 20 }, "quadrant_chart": { "value_range": "0 to 1", "max_points": 20 } } }, "output_requirements": { "language": "clear and precise", "tone": "professional", "avoid": [ "ambiguous labels", "overly complex structures", "missing required elements" ] } }

results.name: GanttChart

nodes.label: Sample Gantt Chart for Project Planning
nodes.info:
gantt
    title Sample Project Gantt Chart
    dateFormat YYYY-MM-DD
    section Planning Phase
    Research :active, r1, 2023-11-01, 14d
    Design :done, d1, 2023-11-15, 10d
    section Development Phase
    Coding :active, c1, 2023-11-25, 21d
    Testing :t1, after c1, 14d
    section Deployment Phase
    Deployment :dep1, after t1, 7d
    Review :rev1, after dep1, 5d

results.ai_instructions: "format": { "types": { "flow_chart": { "syntax": "graph TD", "structure": [ "graph TD", "[Node Label] --> [Connected Node]", "[Node Label] --> [Connected Node]" ], "style": "clear and hierarchical" }, "gantt_chart": { "syntax": "gantt", "structure": [ "gantt", "title [Title]", "dateFormat YYYY-MM-DD", "section [Section Name]", "[Task Name] :[status], [id], [start-date], [duration]" ], "style": "chronological and organized" }, "quadrant_chart": { "syntax": "quadrantChart", "structure": [ "quadrantChart", "title [Title]", "x-axis [Low Label] --> [High Label]", "y-axis [Low Label] --> [High Label]", "quadrant-1 [Description]", "quadrant-2 [Description]", "quadrant-3 [Description]", "quadrant-4 [Description]", "[Item]: [x-value, y-value]" ], "style": "analytical and clear" } } }, "validation": { "common": { "title": "required", "indentation": "4 spaces", "max_items": 50 }, "specific": { "flow_chart": { "max_nodes": 30, "max_connections": 50 }, "gantt_chart": { "date_format": "YYYY-MM-DD", "max_tasks": 20 }, "quadrant_chart": { "value_range": "0 to 1", "max_points": 20 } } }, "output_requirements": { "language": "clear and precise", "tone": "professional", "avoid": [ "ambiguous labels", "overly complex structures", "missing required elements" ] } }

results.name: FullTextNode

nodes.label: Template: Fulltext Node
nodes.info:
[FANCY | font-size: 4.5em; color: #2c3e50; text-align: center]
Title
[END FANCY]

![Header|height: 200px; object-fit: cover; object-position: center](https://vegvisr.imgix.net/HEADERIMG.png)

## Introduction

[SECTION | background-color:#FFFBE6; color:#000]
Main content goes here. You can include regular markdown formatting like **bold**, *italic*, and `code`.
[END SECTION]

[QUOTE | Cited=Author Name]
Important quote or citation goes here.
[END QUOTE]

## Key Points

1. First point
2. Second point
3. Third point

[SECTION | background-color:#E7F7F7; color:#111]
Additional content section
[END SECTION]
